intro: Sorocea affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf sorocea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Sorocea affinis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities and a subject of interest for botanists and ecologists.
